steps.title: Open the Minecraft launcher.
steps.content: Open the Minecraft launcher. Click or double-click the Minecraft app icon, which resembles a grassy block of dirt. If you're using the Windows 10 edition of Minecraft, you can't update manually.

steps.title: Log in if necessary.
steps.content: Log in if necessary. If prompted, enter your email address and password, then click LOG IN .

steps.title: Look for a "Download" tag in the PLAY button.
steps.content: Look for a "Download" tag in the PLAY button. If you see the word "Download" followed by a version number under the PLAY text in the green button at the bottom of the launcher, an update is available for your version of Minecraft. If you don't see any "Download" tag even though you know there's an update available, skip the next two steps.

steps.title: Click PLAY.
steps.content: Click PLAY . It's the green button at the bottom of the launcher. This will prompt the update to begin downloading.

steps.title: Wait for the update to finish downloading.
steps.content: Wait for the update to finish downloading. Once the green progress bar at the bottom of the launcher window disappears, you can proceed with playing Minecraft.

steps.title: Re-download Minecraft if necessary.
steps.content: Re-download Minecraft if necessary. If Minecraft refuses to update even though an update is available in your area, you can try to get the update by re-downloading the most recent version of the Minecraft installer. To do so, uninstall Minecraft from your computer, then do the following: Go to https://minecraft.net/en-us/profile/ and log in if necessary. Click DOWNLOAD in the top-left side of the page. Click the green DOWNLOAD button in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Upgrade to the Minecraft for Windows 10 edition.
steps.content: Upgrade to the Minecraft for Windows 10 edition. If you have a Windows 10 computer on which you own the Java edition of Minecraft, you can upgrade to the Windows 10 edition free of charge by doing the following: Go to https://account.mojang.com/me and log in with your Minecraft account if prompted. Click Redeem under the "Minecraft for Windows 10" heading. Sign into your Microsoft account if prompted. Click Next on the "Redeem" page. Click Confirm . Open the Microsoft Store from Start on your computer. Search for "Minecraft", then click Install on the Minecraft page.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's App Store.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's App Store. Tap the App Store app icon, which resembles a white "A" on a light-blue background.

steps.title: Tap Updates.
steps.content: Tap Updates . It's in the lower-right side of the screen. A list of apps which need updating will appear.

steps.title: Look for Minecraft.
steps.content: Look for Minecraft. Scroll down (if necessary) to find the "Minecraft" app icon and heading. If you don't see Minecraft listed here, an update is not available for it. If your Minecraft isn't up to date, this may be because your iPhone doesn't support the most recent update, or the most recent update may not yet be available in your area.

steps.title: Tap UPDATE.
steps.content: Tap UPDATE . It's to the right of the Minecraft heading. Doing so prompts Minecraft to begin updating.

steps.title: Wait for the update to finish downloading.
steps.content: Wait for the update to finish downloading. Once you see the OPEN button appear next to the Minecraft heading, you can proceed with playing your updated version of Minecraft.

steps.title: Open your Android's Play Store.
steps.content: Open your Android's Play Store. Tap the Play Store app icon, which resembles a multicolored triangle on a white background.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the upper-left side of the screen. A pop-out menu will appear on the left side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap My apps & games.
steps.content: Tap My apps & games . You'll find this option near the top of the pop-out menu.

steps.title: Tap the UPDATES tab.
steps.content: Tap the UPDATES tab. It's in the upper-left side of the "My apps & games" page.

steps.title: Look for Minecraft.
steps.content: Look for Minecraft. Scroll down (if necessary) until you find the "Minecraft" heading and app icon. If you don't see Minecraft listed here, an update is not available for it. If your Minecraft isn't up to date, this may be because your Android doesn't support the most recent update, or the most recent update may not yet be available in your area.

steps.title: Tap UPDATE.
steps.content: Tap UPDATE . It should be to the right of the Minecraft heading. Doing so prompts Minecraft to begin updating.

steps.title: Wait for the update to finish downloading.
steps.content: Wait for the update to finish downloading. Once you see OPEN appear to the right of the Minecraft heading, you can proceed with playing your updated version of Minecraft.

steps.title: Open My apps & games.
steps.content: Open My apps & games . This option is on your Xbox One dashboard.

steps.title: Select Games.
steps.content: Select Games . It's in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select Minecraft.
steps.content: Select Minecraft. Scroll through your games until you find the Minecraft heading, then make sure it's selected.

steps.title: Press the "Menu" ☰ button.
steps.content: Press the "Menu" ☰ button. It's on the right side of the Guide button on your Xbox One controller. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Select Manage game & add-ons.
steps.content: Select Manage game & add-ons . This is in the menu. Doing so opens the game's page.

steps.title: Select the Updates tab.
steps.content: Select the Updates tab. It's in the left-hand pane.

steps.title: Select the update.
steps.content: Select the update. If the update doesn't begin downloading automatically, select it and press A to prompt it to begin downloading. If you don't see an update here, Minecraft is up to date in your region.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen prompts. If asked to confirm the update or select an installation location, do so. Once the update is finished installing, you should be able to play Minecraft like usual.

steps.title: Select Minecraft.
steps.content: Select Minecraft. Go to your game library (or find Minecraft on the dashboard), then move the selection over to cover Minecraft.

steps.title: Press OPTIONS.
steps.content: Press OPTIONS . It's the oval button in the upper-right corner of your controller. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Select Check for Update.
steps.content: Select Check for Update . This option is in the menu.

steps.title: Select Go to [Downloads] when prompted.
steps.content: Select Go to [Downloads] when prompted. This will take you to the Downloads page, which is where you can view your update's download status. If you instead receive a prompt that says "The installed application is the latest version", you cannot update Minecraft now.

steps.title: Wait for the update to finish downloading.
steps.content: Wait for the update to finish downloading. This may take anywhere from a few minutes to a few hours. Once you see "Ready to install" under the update, you can proceed.

steps.title: Install the update.
steps.content: Install the update. Select the update, press X , and press X again when a drop-down menu appears. The update will begin installing onto your PS4's hard drive. You shouldn't have to do anything while the update is installing, but make sure you follow any on-screen prompts if they appear.

steps.title: Select Minecraft.
steps.content: Select Minecraft. Go to the Home page, then move the selection until you've selected Minecraft. [1] X Research source The Minecraft cartridge must be inserted into your Nintendo Switch in order for this to work.

steps.title: Open the "Options" page.
steps.content: Open the "Options" page. With Minecraft selected, press the + or - button to open the "Options" page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Software update.
steps.content: Select Software update . It's in the "Options" menu.

steps.title: Select Via the Internet.
steps.content: Select Via the Internet . This option will appear in a pop-up window. Doing so prompts Minecraft to begin updating.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen prompts. If you see any prompts asking for permission or alerting you that more updates are available, follow them as needed.
